content.title: Ulnar Artery Anatomy
content.description: Medial terminal branch of the brachial artery, larger than radial artery, running along medial aspect of forearm to form the superficial palmar arch.
content.origin: Brachial artery bifurcation in cubital fossa

course.proximal: Passes deep to pronator teres and flexor muscles
course.forearm: Runs with ulnar nerve in distal two-thirds
course.hand: Main contributor to superficial palmar arch

relations.ulnar_nerve: Medial to artery in distal forearm

common_interosseous.importance: May be injured in forearm fractures

clinical_relevance: Guyon's canal syndrome affects adjacent structures
Less commonly used for arterial access than radial
content.statement: Ulnar Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Upper-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Ulnar Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Ulnar Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Ulnar Artery Anatomy.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Ulnar Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
